tweet_text:
Small and rural communities face enormous economic burdens and costs in their effort to respond to #COVID19.
 
That’s why I’m leading the Senate version of the Coronavirus Community Relief Act, to provide $250 billion to help stabilize localities with populations under 500,000.

name: Martin Heinrich
tweet_text: To celebrate the introduction of the Bandelier National Park and Preserve bill, I'd like to see your own experiences in this living cultural landscape. Share your photos of Bandelier by tagging me and using the hashtag #BandelierNP! https://t.co/cVz9bDorNo

name: Martin Heinrich
tweet_text: This legislation has garnered widespread support from local communities throughout northern New Mexico and tribes across Indian Country. I look forward to working with all New Mexicans to establish Bandelier as our newest, and northern New Mexico’s first national park.

name: Martin Heinrich
tweet_text: Creating this new national park is the best way to ensure Bandelier’s cultural treasures and northern New Mexico’s history and natural beauty receive the recognition and protection they have long deserved.

name: Martin Heinrich
tweet_text: Bandelier’s mesas and canyons have human history that dates back more than 10,000 years. The ancestral sites in Bandelier continue to hold deep cultural and religious significance to the pueblos.

name: Martin Heinrich
tweet_text:
Only Congress can create a national park and provide the highest level of protection for cultural resources.
 
It's long past time that we recognize that Bandelier’s historical and natural resources are more than worthy of the protections national park status has to offer.

name: Martin Heinrich
tweet_text:
When I talk to people about what makes New Mexico unique, it always comes back to our breathtaking landscapes, complex history, and unique cultures.
 
That’s why I am so proud to introduce legislation today to make Bandelier our nation’s newest national park.

name: Martin Heinrich
tweet_text: The 2nd volume of the Senate Intel report details Russia's weaponization of social media. Until we set up stronger protections of our election systems & take the necessary steps to prevent future foreign intervention, our democratic institutions will remain vulnerable to attack.

name: Martin Heinrich
tweet_text: We need sweeping action to protect our elections and a comprehensive effort – with social media companies, Congress, federal agencies, and law enforcement working together – to push back on disinformation and false narratives.

name: Martin Heinrich
tweet_text: Right now, Russia and other hostile foreign actors are manipulating social media in an effort to influence the outcome of the 2020 election and sow deeper divisions among the American people.
